instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got this macbook A1502 2015. It starts normally load MacOS but when put password display goes black. Already tried to boot from external macos, safe mode and same is happening. Any idea?

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message:
Do you arrive to boot on a external good system?
Do you have the cursor? if yes.
you can try that in single user mode (CMD+S):

/sbin/fsck -fy

/sbin/mount -uaw

rm /Library/Preferences/com.apple.loginwindow.plist

rm /private/var/db/.AppleUpgrade

reboot

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message: It worked. No i am logged in but macos stuck after a couple of minutes. Will try to reinstall system.

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message:
Try first your USB test OSX.
If still the same, try cleaning ME region in BIOS.

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message: it's only booting in safe mode. So we can discard BIOS?? What can make macbook stuck in normal mode but work in safe?

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message:
Did you try external SSD through USB, disconnecting internal one?
You should have an USB test OSX.

Try PRAM reset.
Clean ME, if no change...

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message:
yes, external usb also boot if safe mode. All is booting but only in safe mode. 

I dont have medusa here now. :(

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message:
Well, it's not EFI, it's not even logic board. I have exactly same macbook and excahgned the board from mine (working) with customer (stucking). after a minute my board stopped working in customers macbook case. One by one i checked all external connections and finally it's display or display cable blocking system. 


How is that possible?

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message: And even if there is way display can block computer ( its not connection loose because it stop recognize HDMI, why in safe mode it doesnt happen?

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message: In safe mode, not all drivers are loaded.

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message:
Yeah, i Know but, it's has nothing to do with LCD cable, right?


Finally changed it and it's working for 20 minutes already without issues.

threads.title: A1502 display goes black after login
threads.message:
Retina display has a dedicated I2C bus for backlight control.
I can only suppose the video cable blocked somehow the communication; because of leakage maybe.
